image.altText: A group of PNG women and babies sitting on a verandah

items.synopsis: A group of bandits that kidnapped an Australian professor in the PNG Highlands appears to have struck again, this time snatching and assaulting a group of women and girls. Warning: Readers might find the details in this story distressing.

title.children: The PNG gang that kidnapped an Australian professor may now be unleashing new horrors on teen girls

image.altText: a cartoon-style drawn building draft of a piece of play equipment in the shape of a pyramid made of rope

items.synopsis: Education Queensland has admitted to destroying trees planted in memory of deceased teachers as part of spending blitz at distance education school.

title.children: Trees planted in memory of deceased teachers were destroyed to build $16,000 shade umbrella in school spending spree

image.altText: Queensland Health Acting director-general Shaun Drummond

items.synopsis: Will the new director-general follow through with a pledge to bring patient safety issues out of the dark?

title.children: Queensland Health boss's successor will have to counter a culture of fear, and let the light in

image.altText: Steve Smith plays a full-blooded cover drive

items.synopsis: Steve Smith scores 85 as Australia make 5-339 after being put in on a green pitch under heavy cloud cover, with protesters disrupting the early stages of the match.

title.children: Brilliant Steve Smith innings puts Australia in box seat at cloudy Lord's

image.altText: Protesters and cricketers tangle while orange smoke fills the air

items.synopsis: Australia was put into bat, and then dominated under leaden skies, as protesters threatened to steal the show early on day one of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title.children: Five quick hits — protesters disrupt play and England gets a taste of Travball

image.altText: A small baby wrapped in a blanket. He is sleeping and his face is obscured by a dummy and nasal feeding tube

items.synopsis: Health officials warn RSV, COVID-19 and influenza are combining to produce a "robust" wave of prolonged winter illnesses.

title.children: It started with a runny nose but RSV left Griffin fighting for life in ICU

image.altText: Vladimir Putin looking contemplatively upwards

items.synopsis: The Wagner mutiny will slowly, over time, corrode the fighting power of the Russian military. And the Ukrainians, who know the Russian military better than anyone on the planet, will be sure to exploit this, writes Mick Ryan.

title.children: Physical, intellectual and moral: Three ways the Wagner mutiny will impact Russian fighting power

image.altText: A lake surrounded by hills.

items.synopsis: Questions are being raised over the feasibility of the Queensland government's pumped hydro schemes announced last year.

title.children: 'Not logical': Experts question Queensland government plans to build mega pumped hydro

image.altText: Taylor Swift sings into a microphone while performing on stage.

items.synopsis: American pop star Taylor Swift adds two new shows to her 2024 Australian tour, which organisers say will be the final dates to be announced.

title.children: Taylor Swift adds two 'final' shows to Australian tour after 'historically unprecedented demand'

image.altText: A side shot of a man's face and neck.

items.synopsis: Not so long ago, the idea of a National Anti-Corruption Commission was dismissed as a "fringe issue" by Scott Morrison. No-one is suggesting that now, writes David Speers.

title.children: Will Stuart Robert be one of the new National Anti-Corruption Commission's first targets?

image.altText: Steve Smith hits a straight drive back between the legs of a reaching Josh Tongue

items.synopsis: The stage could not have been more perfectly set for England to back up its post-Edgbaston confidence on day one at Lord's, but the hosts came out flat and the Australians took full advantage, writes Dean Bilton.

title.children: Bazball bluster turns to Lord's lethargy as England tackles day one with a lack of energy

image.altText: Debris from the Titan submersible recovered from the ocean floor.

items.synopsis: The first pieces of debris from the Titan submersible are brought back to port in Canada, with investigators hoping they can learn more about the submersible's implosion.

title.children: Debris from imploded Titan submersible returned to shore as investigation continues

image.altText: Unidentifiable close up photo of an Indigenous man in a park

items.synopsis: While many jurisdictions say they don't use spit hoods in youth detention facilities and watch housing, only one state has explicitly banned them using legislation.

title.children: Marley says wearing a spit hood felt like 'getting kidnapped'. He wants them banned

image.altText: A man walks across a train track, in front of the Altona Oil Refinery site

items.synopsis: For more than half a century, the Mobil oil refinery was at the heart of Melbourne's industrial west. But since its closure two years ago, vastly different hopes for the site's future have emerged.

title.children: 'Middle suburbs, excellent transport, great deal of land': The battle for the future of an old oil refinery

image.altText: A young Indigenous boy chases a woman in a nun's gown across a wheat field.

items.synopsis: The Oscar-winning actress and acclaimed director have long wanted to work together — an 18-year-old screenplay was their spark.

title.children: How Cate Blanchett became a renegade nun in Warwick Thornton's latest film

image.altText: ChatGPT

items.synopsis: As ChatGPT comes under increasing scrutiny, one Victorian country newspaper is already using artificial intelligence to fill column space.

title.children: Editor defends decision to publish article written by artificial intelligence in regional newspaper

image.altText: A woman speaks in front of several microphones

items.synopsis: As the state's corruption watchdog today hands down its ruling on Gladys Berejiklian, the former premier's downfall can be traced back to a separate inquiry.

title.children: Inside the corruption inquiry into former NSW premier Gladys Berejiklian, as findings released today

image.altText: An older, heavyset white man in a suit with a moustache stands behind a podium.

items.synopsis: Mr Putin initially vowed to crush the Wagner Group's mutiny, but hours later a deal was clinched to allow Mr Prigozhin and some of his mercenary fighters to go to Belarus.

title.children: Lukashenko says Putin wanted to 'wipe out' Prigozhin, as Zelenskyy calls Russian leaders 'bandits'

image.altText: Danny and Michael sitting down looking down at a screen

items.synopsis: With youthful energy and a quintessentially Australian soundtrack, the debut film from the RackaRacka brothers hits all the right notes.

title.children: Australian 'in a way that doesn't feel gross': Lifelong dream comes true for Adelaide filmmakers

image.altText: A twin sister standing next to each other holding a painting in their hands.

items.synopsis: A Russian missile strike on a busy restaurant in the city of Kramatorsk in eastern Ukraine has killed at least 11 people and injured dozens.

title.children: Twin sisters among 11 killed by Russian attack on Ukraine restaurant

image.altText: Shane Barker and family composite thumbnail image.

items.synopsis: After a 14-year wait for justice, the family of murdered Tasmanian man Shane Barker tell of their relief and thank those who pushed for answers about their loved one's death as his killers are jailed.

title.children: 'We finally got justice': Family of Shane Barker express relief after murder trial guilty verdicts

image.altText: A parked car on fire with flames and smoke coming out late at night in France

items.synopsis: A 17-year-old boy who worked as a delivery driver is shot dead by police during a traffic stop, sparking anger and unrest.

title.children: 'Unexplainable and inexcusable': Macron lays into police after teen shot dead and Paris riots

image.altText: A young man walks across a manufacturing business floor while wearing a mask.

items.synopsis: A new report from the Centre for Policy Development looks at the unique challenges facing a range of Australia's most coal and gas-exposed communities, including the Hunter, Pilbara, Latrobe and Gladstone regions.

title.children: Why coal-producing communities will need more than just hydrogen to adapt to clean future

image.altText: A man in a suit looks at a wired technological contraption.

items.synopsis: Labor will rely on international partners to provide crucial Earth observation data, after scrapping a Morrison government plan to develop new Australian satellites.

title.children: Labor axes Morrison government's billion dollar Australian satellite program

image.altText: Artist impression of a violent merger between two stars

items.synopsis: Around 520 light years away lies a Jupiter sized planet that should have been destroyed.  So how did it survive?  It could have been like Tatooine from Star Wars.

title.children: 'The most fun part of science': Scientists discover a planet that should not exist

image.altText: A muddy four wheel drive.

items.synopsis: South Australian road trippers on their way to the Big Red Bash in Birdsville are left stranded with the Birdsville Track in the state's far north forced to close due to heavy rain.

title.children: Birdsville Track closure leaves Big Red Bash goers stranded

image.altText: A serious young woman, red hair tied up, pink jumper, holds a baby with ribbon in red hair, fridge behind, with magnets.

items.synopsis: A year after dozens of women launched a complaint about their treatment while giving birth at this regional hospital, more are coming forward to share their "traumatic" experiences.

title.children: Natalie felt like she was being 'tortured' while giving birth. Now the hospital is under scrutiny

image.altText: A dark picture of a black man wearing a black top, against a dark background.

items.synopsis: Actor Idris Elba describes his latest TV series Hijack as "pure escapism" as he continues to challenge audience expectations throughout his successful career.

title.children: 'Pure escapism': Idris Elba challenges audience expectations in new Hijack show

image.altText: Arisa Trew on a skating ramp wearing a pink helmet with her arms spread out standing on an angle on a skateboard.

items.synopsis: The 13-year-old Olympic hopeful nailed the trick made famous by Tony Hawk in front of the skateboarding legend himself.

title.children: Gold Coast teen Arisa Trew becomes the first female to land a 720 in competition

image.altText: A baby wearing a white headband receives kisses on the cheek from her mother and father on each side.

items.synopsis: South Koreans become a year or two younger today as new laws that require using only the international method of counting age take effect, replacing the country's traditional method.

title.children: South Koreans become one year younger today

image.altText: A mural of SA Police officers.

items.synopsis: A new mural in Adelaide's CBD depicting two police officers on duty has been labelled a "misstep" by a state MP.

title.children: Mural in Adelaide's CBD labelled 'misstep' as SA Police refuse to outline cost
